title: The Bell Jar
description: This is an alternative cover edition for ISBN 9780571081783We follow Esther Greenwood's personal life from her summer job in New York with Ladies' Day magazine, back through her days at New England's largest school for women, and forward through her attempted suicide, her bad treatment at one asylum and her good treatment at another, to her final re-entry into the world like a used tyre: "patched, retreaded, and approved for the road" ... Esther Greenwood's account of her year in the bell jar is as clear and readable as it is witty and disturbing.'The Bell Jar' is Plath's only novel and was originally published under a pseudonym in 1963.
author: Sylvia Plath
